website_summaries.verdict: Chamberlain's MyQ Garage should be the first on your list if you want to add some smarts to your garage door. Just prepare your wallet for the urge to link it to other devices.
pros: The Chamberlain MyQ Garage is one of the most affordable smart garage-door openers, and also one of the easiest to install
cons: It works with a growing list of other smart home products, but notables like SmartThings and Revolv still don't have official support

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a year. It occasionally gets confused and will tell you that the door is open when it's actually closed. Yesterday, it decided that one of my two garage door sensors was malfunctioning and prompted me to test the system. It the automagically deleted one of the doors and the app locks up when attempting to re-add it. Tried on two different android devices. This product is not ready for prime time and is too buggy to something as important as control access to your home. Also, the MyQ Android app is not capable of auto-rotating the screen, you have to hold your device in a single orientation. Dumb. You had ONE JOB Chamberlain.
customer_reviews.author: Corey T. Renner

customer_reviews.title: The software associated with this device is pretty aweful. Despite the products claims to the contrary
customer_reviews.text: The software associated with this device is pretty aweful. Despite the products claims to the contrary, the scheduling feature doesn't work, which is a main feature I discovered I wanted. This means I cannot use the 'smart' app to ensure the door is closed at night. I was also hoping to use the GPS and voice commands in my phone to close the door, but again, the app doesn't handle delayed instructions. I am finding the idea of a smart door opener, accessible through my phone really useful, even more so than when I bought the unit, but the software associated with this unit is pretty bad. Meaning, this is not the unit you should buy.
customer_reviews.author: greiber

customer_reviews.title: Possibly worst purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought version one when it first came out with Homekit compatibility on the box. As we all know, it was not compatible. Then came a beta program to shut up those who complained. It still does not function. Not even as a simple switch. After promising a replacement, Charles at Chamberlain no longer returns my emails trying to make it function. Check the email trail of this disaster from early adopters search for: HomeKit Update 1/6/16
customer_reviews.author: Macgreiner

customer_reviews.title: Has decent WiFi range, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: You don't need to mount the router on the ceiling, I tried a couple of different wall locations in the garage and they worked just fine and WiFi reception wasn't a problem (see photo). Mine is mounted on the wall next to a cupboard. Once setup, this is a really cool product. When you remotely close the door, it flashes and beeps to warn anybody in the garage that the door is about to close. Setting up alerts was a breeze. It took me less than 2 minutes to setup a push alert letting me know if the door is opened during the weekday (while my family and I are away). Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: B. Hochstrasser

customer_reviews.title: No Longer Supports SmartThings.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how this is at all valuable. It no longer works with SmartThings (I bought it thinking it still did), so there's no proximity detection. Getting it set up on my Genie Pro Max took about 10 tries to finally work, and my garage wireless remote no longer works now. I'd give it 4-5 stars if it just worked with SmartThings or had its own better native app for detecting proximity and automation for the garage door, but as it stands, all this is is a way to open and close your garage door from your iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Stay

customer_reviews.title: Nice try, but BIG MISS on delivering 'scheduling' feature
customer_reviews.text: I have this controller paired to a brand new Genie garage door opener, and in general this MyQ works well for alerting when the garage door opens or closes. However, I purchased this also to be able to schedule my garage door to close/open per the listed features. This feature does not work, and there are a multitude of other customers who bought this unit specifically to be able to schedule their door to open/close. BIG DISAPPOINTMENT !!! I would not recommend this version of this product to anyone if they need the scheduling feature. Otherwise, as long as you have a stable internet connection in your home network/wifi, it should be OK.
customer_reviews.author: Big Wave Dave

customer_reviews.title: Scheduling is disabled, product description is inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: One of the only reasons we bought this controller was the scheduling function. We have forgotten a few times to close the garage door and loved that I was told in the product literature that we could schedule a closure of the garage at a specific time however Chamerlain has disabled this features as of the past week or so with no timeline of when it will be available again. I’m going to keep it through the amazon return period to see if it is enabled again but it not I’ll be returning this product. On Chamerlain’s website there is tons of angry folks with the same gripe I have and nobody’s getting any answers.
customer_reviews.author: zedkiller

customer_reviews.title: Need sensor for each door = expensive + scheduled closing is deactivated by factory app
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly easy to set up. I suggest using the app to set up hub, and not setting up hub independently, because app makes you reset it again to factory settings. My main beef is I wanted a way to automatically close the garage door at night. Evidently MyQ has disabled this!!!!!!! My next beef is that you have to buy sensors for each door. This particular unit the G0201 is limited on sensors you can used. They cost as much or more than the whole setup with hub, so I need to buy 2 more because I have 3 small garages! Otherwise it works almost as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Swarts

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to work with - both device and Chamberlain
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but problems with this device in the 2 years since we've tried it. The latest is changing the WiFi settings. It simply cannot be done. And when you clear the WiFi settings and try to set it back up in the app, it doesn't recognize the door sensor. But this is just the latest in a long list of issues, 10 hours on the phone with support trying to fix one issue, they pull support for notifications and refuse to work with Alexa or any other smarthome integration. Basically, this is trash.
customer_reviews.author: MattM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with a little modification to closing alarm😊
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, only took about two minutes to install to iPhone. The only negative was the alarm when closing the door. I pulled the two Philip's screws off the back cover, used the same philips screwdriver to disable the speaker, I stuck the screwdriver into the center hole on speaker, gave it a few twists, and no more alarm 😊
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very inconsistent and gets worse over time
customer_reviews.text: 1 year after purchase. This item does not work. I've had to uninstall the application several times throughout the last year with inconsistent results. Finally today, I found out neither the sensor nor the hub are functional at all. Battery change? Didn't work. Delete app, factory reset hub, start from scratch? Didn't work. My hardware is now in the garbage. The reviews for this item's competitor were awful, which is why I chose this unit despite its incompatibility with smart home A.I. I guess the technology just isn't there yet for this idea...
customer_reviews.author: Riordan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money to buy this. You can listen now or learn by experience later.
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years having this piece of garbage, I can easily say, I never use any of this company’s products. Every few months I will get offline message and I have to go through hell to reset it. The app they refer everything to it has lack of any proper functionality in different scenarios. All of technical supports try to blame reception or garage opener, while all of them are in %100 working condition and reception as it woks in between error messages. I can easily say if the amount of time I spent to make it work, I worked with minimum wage, I would afford to buy a newest garage opener with wireless functionality every 6 months!
customer_reviews.author: Afshin A

customer_reviews.title: Subscription required for IFTTT?!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product. They said they would be releasing IFTTT support which would allow me to do one thing: close the garage door automatically when my Nest thinks I’m not home. IFTTT integration is now live but at the cost of a chamberlain subscription! That’s ridiculous. Very few people are going to pay a subscription for a household appliance, smart or not. No way Jose. I’ll be looking at other garage opener brands when it’s time to replace. I’m sure Chamberlain has competitors with business plans that aren’t stuck in the ‘70s.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: The hub and sensor work great. I also purchased a second sensor because my ...
customer_reviews.text: The hub and sensor work great. I also purchased a second sensor because my house has two single car garages. The MyQ app is garbage and there's no interoperability with any other smart home devices besides setting temperature with Nest thermostats, but I can give it a pass on that. I know they're adding HomeKit integration with the next version coming this summer. For the most part, it works flawlessly. Interestingly, on cloudy, wet days, the second sensor has trouble communicating with the hub. It takes a couple of tries to get the garage door open. But I live in the San Diego area, so those days are few and far between. Overall, I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Don't presume this will work for you
customer_reviews.text: Originally worked as advertised, but after a Comcast router update it stopped. After several days of trying to restore the function, and hours on the phone with Chamberlain, there's no hope. I have 6 other WiFi connected devices, thermostat, cameras etc, and all restarted after the router update, but this thing is worthless. Chamberlain now says the router is incompatible. Really, that's their solution. Now I see a lot of other's with the same problem, so perhaps they'll fix this, but my suggestion, if you buy one of these, is to make sure you can re-program this thing more than once during the first few months, so if yours decides not to work you'll be within the return-it-to-Amazon time frame.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Genie door openers made in 2016 or later.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with Genie door openers that were made in 2016 or later. This includes Genie model 3024, which is the model that we have. This has been a problem with the Chamberlain MyQ system for almost two years, and the company still has not fixed it yet. There are hundreds of complaints online about this, and several Chamberlain support reps have said they are going to update their packaging to warn users that it doesn't work with Genie door openers built in 2016 or later. However, the packaging still does not reflect this.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! Easy to install and the android app works great. A note to new users, the blinking light (when shutting the garage) and the beeping that follows is a required safety feature that cannot be disabled (officially) however if you disregard those safety rules, you can always open it up manually and disconnect the speaker. The idea is that if nobody is around when you remotely shut the garage, the sound and light alerts people that a door is closing nearby and to be cautious. So far this remote has been fantastic for me and is another welcome addition to my smart home.
customer_reviews.author: Greell

customer_reviews.title: Right kit for existing openers & all in one package.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for existing openers and need for App control and status. We always wondered did we close door. Did kids leave open when they left. We have a 2006 chamberlain liftmaster professional. Worked well and just what we needed. Fair price compared to others. Easy to install, if you read instructions. Wifi connection and phone app very easy. Install is two screws and power plugin. Door sensor is one button setup. Highly recommend. Ceiling device connects to your home wifi. Sensor mounts to garage door and "talks" to ceiling device. Phone controls and monitors garage door. We added a 2nd sensor to 2nd garage door.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install...
customer_reviews.text: This garage door works great once you get it installed. I can open my door from miles away to let friends and family in. It also alerts Me if it been open more than an hour. No more leAving it open over night. The directions show you to plug in the receiver next to the opener when in fact you need to plug it in several feet away. The other issue is it blinked red when it was connecting directions showed it should be green. But after it was hooked smooth sailing.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: I now have a piece of useless hardware
customer_reviews.text: When Chamberlain updated their software, I tried it and it would not work. I sent a message to customer support. They never replied. Now the software that did work has expired. So I now have a useless piece of junk. Do I need to say I would definitely not recommend this product or this company?
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I installed this product the other day and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I installed this product the other day and have to say it was fairly seamless (a second unit, installed by my not so technologically-savvy father was also a breeze I was told). The app works well, with just a slight delay. The reason I purchased the app was because of the numerous times I had left my garage door open and went to sleep at night. Through the app, I was able to set an alert which sends a push notification to my iPhone whenever my garage door is open between the hours of 10pm and 6am - pretty useful little $90 insurance policy if you ask me!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: NEVER READS ACCURATELY - SAVE YOUR $$$
customer_reviews.text: Never reads accurately app displays open when the garage is really closed. Amazon calls on almost every delivery saying they can’t get into garage because the app reads (Garage Open). Paid over $100 and today they are giving them away at $39.99 which is a lot of money for a garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: It works, Make sure you check sensor battery if having issues
customer_reviews.text: It works, takes a little to set up, but it works. Make sure you check sensor battery if having issues. Installed in May of 2017, took a few tries to get it working but it works. I get the notifications on my iphone and apple watch when opens, or stays open. It started giving me false alerts about 14-15 months after installation (i.e. said it was still open when closed, or said had just opened when it was closed) A quick replacement of the sensor battery fixed the issue.
customer_reviews.author: charliebear

customer_reviews.title: PAID MONTHLY SUBSCRIPTION for smart home Integration
customer_reviews.text: It was a ok product . It need improvement in it's notification text . I gave 2 🌟 becasue they enable google home ,IFTTT ,Alexa might be in future but you have to use PAID MONTHLY SUBSCRIPTION
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Don't give up, move the hub around your ceiling before returning.
customer_reviews.text: After playing around with the location of the hub, this works very well. My issue was when I tried to add the second garage door, the open and close command would control both doors. After scouring the internet I remedied this issue by moving the hub further away from the first opener. Also, If you're concerned about interference from LED lights, I have 3 LED shop lights on the ceiling of my garage that are wired to motion sensor and they do not seem to effect the opener. Works every time I get home and when I leave/close. Also works well with Wink Hub. You can even control them with your apple watch. A+
customer_reviews.author: ASUengineer

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, bad integration
customer_reviews.text: Setup is pretty easy and it works, but you should get a product that has better integration with other services. While plenty of smart home products are adding free integration with a number of services, Chamberlain has decided to charge separate monthly fees for integration with ifttt and Google Assistant. There is also no multi user support. This could be a great product, but it is handicapped by the attempt to nickel and dime customers
customer_reviews.author: A_Str8

customer_reviews.title: poor product don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product thinking I would be able to schedule the device to automatically close and open as it was advertised to do. The company said there was a problem with the feature and their engineers were working on the problem and have disabled the feature. It has been over 8 months and it is still not working. They knowingly sold a defective product and falsely advertised a product with a feature that does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin L. Benoit

customer_reviews.title: It just doesn't get any easier than this!
customer_reviews.text: It seriously is super simple to install the MyQ Garage unit. I'm an IT professional, very hands on, but regardless the instructions are simple and concise. The only part I was confused about is the app for my iPhone. This was easy to figure out since the other two apps in the app store are geared to other garage door manufacturers. I mounted both devices with the provided screws. I checked my WiFi signal from the proposed location. I'm amazed on just how simple this was. I installed the app on two phones, did a demonstration for my wife, and she was really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: heperez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and setup and works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first home with a garage and within 2 weeks I had to spend 90 minutes in traffic to return home because I couldn't remember if I closed the door when I left. With my Chamberlain MYQ-G0201 i get a reminder I the garage door is left open and i can close it no matter where I am. My only disappointment with this model is that I am unable to set a schedule. Maybe an app update will correct this.
customer_reviews.author: Rputney

customer_reviews.title: Beware the Phantom Operations
customer_reviews.text: It's all fun & games until the "phantom operations" begin to occur where your garage door just opens and closes randomly. Not just once but sometimes multiple times during the day. If not for the camera system I wouldn't have known that the door was open. It's too un-secure for me. I had to yank it!
customer_reviews.author: Keeping it Real

customer_reviews.title: Near impossible to set up
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for over a year now and it works fine after you get it set up, occasionally the servers are non-responsive but for the most part it works. For the most part is not what you want when you're relying on your door to open but it's good most of the time. The real problem is setting the danged thing up. If the battery dies then you have to go through the set up process which is convoluted and doesn't really work and when it does, more often than not it just removes the other door. I'd suggest going with a different product if you have that option.
customer_reviews.author: icepick

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted only 16 months before it broke. After troubleshooting with the technician, he determined the door sensor was non-functional. With a 1 year warranty, they wouldn't replace any parts. Worse yet, the sensor was unavailable and the model has been superseded by a newer model (which looks almost exactly the same), yet the sensor is incompatible. I've had no luck finding an aftermarket sensor. The only option is to replace the entire unit. Up until it broke, it was virtually flawless, except for maybe a couple times when MyQ had server issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I was always having to inside and open the garage door. Now I can open the garage from my phone, which I almost always have on me. I can also check to see if I closed the door from my phone. Being able to set an alert to tell me if the garage door has be open for longer than 30 minutes is a nice feature too. This paired up with my Genie garage door with no issues. Install was quick and easy, probably took me about 15 minutes. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Hotshot

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and connects without issues from a 50 ft. distance from my router. Installation was very simple and took about 10 minutes. After screwing the unit to the ceiling and plugging it in, you connect via WiFi and pair it with your garage. The separate sensor sticks to the garage door to tell if the garage is open (laying flat) or closed (standing upright). The app responds within 1-2 seconds when opening, but closing it gives a buzzer (for safety?) for a few seconds before closing. The iPhone method of connecting didn't work, but the alternative web approach worked great. The unit has survived -15 degrees in the garage without any issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Levesque

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with Phone App, Google Home Integration Costs $10 / Year
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up for use with phone app, and phone app is great (even supports fingerprint recognition). But Google Home integration as of this moment (May 2019) is only by paying $10 / year (or $1 / mo) to enable the integration service. And even then you have to "talk to MyQ" before you ask about the garage door being open or shut. So I'm sticking with the phone app, which is plenty good enough for us.
customer_reviews.author: Ch1cag0rob

customer_reviews.title: Might want to steer clear of this device.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a couple of weeks or so. You might want to steer clear from this device. It had initially malfunctioned the first day of install and I reset it. It had been working since, but last night it started to report garage door opened and it was not. And just now it did it again a few hours later. Do not know why it is doing this. Cannot have a device like this fail. Creates a false sense of security or no security. No real way to verify if messages are real or not. Going to take it offline and not put it up again.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: ... to use my iPhone to control my garage is awesome and extremely convenient
customer_reviews.text: Having the ability to use my iPhone to control my garage is awesome and extremely convenient. However, there are 2 reasons keeping the MyQ from being perfect: 1) sometimes there is a 30 second to 1 minute delay from when I open the app to when I can utilize the app even though I'm standing within 50 feet of the router. 2) Resetting the MyQ to work with a new router / router password can be troublesome and timely. It's supposed to be intuitive and easy but it doesn't always work out that way. However (again) I have recommended this to everyone I know.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Installation was simple and the system is working as designed
customer_reviews.text: Installation was simple and the system is working as designed. Two minor complaints are the built-in safety feature that has a audible alarm that sounds before and while the door is closing. Also, there is a substantial delay from the time you actually request the door to close and when it actually begins the act of closing. Now, having said all of that, i have not yet checked to see if you are able to "override" or "modify" the closing process in anyway. It may be customizable and I'm just not aware at this time. But my overall initial assessment is that this is a good product and was perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Diaz

customer_reviews.title: After a while it suddenly stopped working.  Frustrated. Disconnected and shelved unit. Boo.
customer_reviews.text: Unit stopped working suddenly. Unsuccessful at multiple attempts to repair hub with my wifi network. Blue light indicates wifi connected, but neither my iPhone 7 nor my Netgear router sees it. Changed battery in door sensor etc. Disappointed with lack of info on hot to troubleshoot when error code 307 hub won't connect. 3 hrs after trying to reconnect (redownloaded everything etc) I removed the unit from service and it is on my shelf in a plastic bag. I can't bring myself to toss it in the garbage yet. It was $130. I will toss it away in a few months after it gathers some dust. All my remotes work fine. Stick to them. Don't rely on this product.
customer_reviews.author: ElohseeKay

customer_reviews.title: We let the Air Conditioner repair man in our garge from Spain!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is wonderful! Easy to install. In fact I had my daughter do the install. You can see if the garage door is open from anywhere you have cell service. You can also open and close the door from anywhere you have cell service or Wi-Fi. You can allow anyone you want to have the ability to open or close the garage door. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Lacy

customer_reviews.title: This was easy to install on my old garage door
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install on my old garage door, and it works flawlessly ever since. I did not get a warning about the battery running out, so that surprised me once. The app from Chamberlain is surprisingly good, and integrates well with other devices like thermostats. Really, couldn't be happier with value for the cost and ease of installation and quality of the app. Nice product for sure
customer_reviews.author: dhof

customer_reviews.title: Good product, slow app
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Installation was relatively easy and straight forward and the programming with my LiftMaster MyQ garage opener worked at first attempt. The sensor works accurately enough. The only criticism I have is that the app (I use Android) is slow; it requires authentication upon opening (I haven't found a way to circumvent this) and response is on the slow side. Not too bad, though, especially if this is not the main remote.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wieland

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for the paid subscription to use the integrations
customer_reviews.text: This product works fine with the exception of the integration to Google assistant and Alexa. In order to use these simple services you need to buy a subscription which is ridiculous. Why pay for a service so you can speak to Google or Alexa. I will be purchasing a different garage opener. No loyalties for me if Chamberlain just is going to nickle and dime me.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Wished I had got this sooner...
customer_reviews.text: Install - Very easy to install and get up and running. Installation literally took me like 20 minutes tops. The instructions were well laid out and syncing this device to my router was a piece of cake. App - I love the push notifications as to when my garage door opens and closes. It will also tell you how long it has been opened or closed. In fact, I viewed my garage door status while I typed this review. If you are looking for a peace of mind if you closed your garage when you leave for work in morning. This is it.... pure...plain.. and simple... for the price, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: The app is ugly, the connection is terrible, and whats with that beep?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be nice, and since it is part of the 'Work with Nest' family I thought it would be neat. The connection was terrible. My service in the garage was alright on my tablet and phone, but the My Q hub couldnt pick up the signal. I bought a range extender and that helped with the connection, but it still lost connection every time the door opened or closed. Also, the unit beeps while its opening or closing, and when the signal gets lost it continues to beep until it gets a signal again. The ap needs work as well. It looks like the IOS app was designed for an iPhone 4.
customer_reviews.author: CliffySkogs

customer_reviews.title: Good product, does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised with my Craftsman garage dooropener. Easy installation, about 5 mins. I use it to open the door remotely for the maid but I kind of like the bonus features - now my phone alerts me if my door is still open after a specific hour or for too many hours in a row.
customer_reviews.author: The PM

customer_reviews.title: Easily configurable and works great if you install it properly ...
customer_reviews.text: Easily configurable and works great if you install it properly and follow the instructions on attaching the sensor to the door. I installed my units 5 weeks ago and haven't had any failure. The alerts are very accurate, remote open/close great. You can use the same MyQ-Garage unit and buy second sensor for the second door. Don't try to extend it to the third door by buying additional, third sensor. This product is designed to work for up to 2 doors.If you have 3-4 doors in your garage, you would need to buy another MYQ-G0201.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, works great. Make sure that the hub and sensor can "see" each other. If the hub isn't in line of sight of the sensor it will not work properly. I wish you could do more automation with the product, but unfortunately both Chamberlain and Wink will not allow it to be set up as a robot for security reasons much like my front door locks. I suspect there is a way to bypass this, but for now I have a robot set up in Wink to turn on my lights in my house when the garage door is opened after dusk and before dawn. It's nice to walk into a lit house late at night!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Android users, pair to MyQ with Bluetooth first, then continue setup.
customer_reviews.text: With Android phones, you need to have your phone pair to the MyQ Garage opener over bluetooth first. Then continue to setup with your home wi-fi setup. The instructions made it seem Android users could skip that bluetooth step. Anyways, once that was done, the device setup is perfect. I have peace of mind knowing I can access and control my Wayne-Dalton garage door from anywhere at anytime.
customer_reviews.author: User, Tron fought for me.

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for a great price...
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. I use to always come home and find where the garage door was left open by one of the children or where we had to wait to make sure that one of the remote openers closed the door. Now I get an alert whenever the door is opened and I can check to see if it is closed even if I am out of town. I can also close it remotely. For the price this additional peace of mind is priceless. Setup was easy.
customer_reviews.author: JEC100

customer_reviews.title: Unable to keep it safe from others connecting to it.
customer_reviews.text: I found the unit works great for opening, closing and monitoring the status of your door. However, we live in a townhouse condo development and a neighbor somehow has our channel and they open our door all of the time. They apparently come and go quite a bit, so I had to stop using it. Instructions are poor for this and I have tried numerous times to change the channel or reprogram to no avail, our neighbor continues to have connection to our door.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for truly remote control of garage doors. My opener is same brand and setup is a breeze. NOTE: when configuring the WIFI on android, make sure to put h t t p : / / in front of the configuration url. Depending on your android device's browser, makes the difference between page not found and actual configuration site.
customer_reviews.author: Gugo46

customer_reviews.title: This is a good thing because I left my garage door open once ...
customer_reviews.text: I have "enjoyed" MY Q for about a year. Then I replaced my router. It took 6 weeks to get it reinstalled. Chamberlain advertises that you can set a schedule to close your door automatically. This is a good thing because I left my garage door open once and got royally ripped off.. HOWEVER they had trouble with this feature so instead of fixing it THEY TURNED IT OFF in Dec 2016. The promised fix never appeared. POOR customer support, misleading advertised features. AVOID IT.
customer_reviews.author: topgum

customer_reviews.title: Great Product with very easy to insall
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot others reviews regarding the installation, especially the location to put the Gateway/Receiver. Installed yesterday, within 10 min. Very simple and easy as long as follow the APP instruction. 1. As others mentioned, I placed the gateway/receiver on the wall which is opposing/facing to the garage door. 2. I have a Chamberlain Garage Door Opener. Make sure the color of the Program Button on the opener, which is required during installation. The only hiccup is the original remote controllers, which doesn't work after this installed. I will try to re-program my remote today.
customer_reviews.author: Mic

customer_reviews.title: Usually works, but unreliable enough to be annoying
customer_reviews.text: It mostly works, but it is really annoying when it doesn't. Smart devices NEED to be very reliable. This device is not always reliable. It has skipped noticing door position changes and then displayed the wrong status. It has has sent erroneous notifications when the door position did not change.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Certainly recommend. Friend already picked one up too!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it used. The unit works perfectly and arrived looking brand new. My only complaint was that if you purchase a used unit you will need to call Chamberlain to have them remove the previous account off of the unit for you to be able to set it up. Chamberlain is easy to work with and did this quickly for me. After that it is very easy to set up and use each day. Now I know when the garage is opened, and I also know if I forgot to close the door after leaving home. One of my friends has already bought one too since he liked mine so much
customer_reviews.author: noah wilson

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product on Black Friday. I tried to install on 12/19 and the website stated the serial number was already in use. I went to the Chamberlain forum and noted this is recurring issue. When I spoke to a chamberlain representative they stated that sometimes people return the product. AMAZON and CHAMBERLAIN SHOULD NOT BE SELLING THESE AS NEW. He stated he would to a another department and they would email me so I could send a picture of the serial number in my possession! Very disappointed in both Chamberlain and Amazon for faulty product sold on false pretenses as being new. Now I have a $100 brick
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Ruckus

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, performs as described
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, only took about 10 minutes before I was controlling the garage remotely. Make sure to connect to the controller via wifi, and then attempt to pair on the app. Wish I could turn the beeps off while remotely initiating the open or closing, but I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P

customer_reviews.title: Never wonder if your garage door is open or closed.
customer_reviews.text: It's alittle hard to link up with your home's wifi, but if I can do it, so can just about anyone. Otherwise, the installation was pretty easy. More importantly, anytime the garage door opens or closes, I get an alert. What's more, you can open or close the garage door right from your smartphone from anywhere you get a phone signal. I no longer wonder if I've left the garage door open. When in doubt, I just open the app on my phone and see. It's totally awesome and a major peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: and I would consider myself pretty technically savvy
customer_reviews.text: Could not get this thing to connect or work, and I would consider myself pretty technically savvy. I was on the phone with tech support from Comcast as well as Chamberlain for hours. I ended up getting a new opener installed that had the MyQ built into the unit and it worked perfectly. Go figure
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible security risk - Door will open randomly on its own
customer_reviews.text: Mostly works and set up wasn't too bad. Connected to Wink Hub fine, able to control from Wink App, IFTT, etc... UNFORTUNATELY, this product suffers badly from a "Phantom Door" syndrome. Door opens randomly, several times a day. It's a known issue - others are complaining on various boards and manufacturer refuses to acknowledge it - they give silly explanations, like "when you programmed it, your neighbor pressed his remote at the same time (imagine likelihood of that!) and now their garage opens yours. No, sir! Unplugging this unit immediately stops the problem. I'm returning it and trying another manufacturer...
customer_reviews.author: Mount Olympus

customer_reviews.title: Support is non-existent
customer_reviews.text: Used the product for a couple of years with no issues. However, while away, my ISP (xFinity) went and changed my router settings such that the required 2.4 wireless password had to be changed. No problem I thought, I'll just update the settings. Got into MyQ app and tried to do so and it can't find the required SID to connect to the hub and make the changes. Now comes the really bad part: all URL's for support or contact to the Chamberlain site return a blank page!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur J. Dolben

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I saw this advertised and went to Amazon right away to buy it because on so many occasions my husband and I drive away from the house and then question whether or not we closed the garage door, and have to drive back to the house to double check. Despite some of the reviews stating this was hard to install, we found it relatively easy to install and sync with our iPhones. The app works perfectly and it is such a relief to simply check an app to see if the door is open or closed, and be able to open and close it remotely if necessary. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Really great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought from K&T Trading Post. Great seller, and great product. Lost our remote and instead of buying a new separate remote, I bought this. I did need some help from chamberlain and they walked me through a flawless setup and it works from any phone I choose to use! This is a benefit if I ever lose or forget my phone, I can ask another to open the garage for me! Also alerts me if the door opens without my permission. Very easy to put in place.
customer_reviews.author: Diadem

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this.....now I can always know if my garage door is open. It works even 3 floors below my router. The hardest part of setting it up was the app. The instructions tell you to follow the app instructions, but they are not very clear. I learned that I needed to set up two things, one tells you if the door is open and when and the other allows you to open and close if via the web or iphone. The only recommendation I can give is that the app be a little more user friendly. LOVE, LOVE LOVE the product.
customer_reviews.author: Rosierobins

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Update: After a little more than a year in use, died and fails to reprogram even though the first few steps work during the setup process. It does exactly what it says it is supposed to do, the directions were straight forward and unit was able to connect to my home wi-fi without any problems. I did move it closer to the house (was originally in the middle of the garage) but otherwise worked as described. Also connected to my Wink hub with no issues by authenticating with the Chamberlain account. My only "complaint" is Alexa/Echo does not support this device yet so its not discovered or usable though Alexa voice commands.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Frappier

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works well. Need to support integration into Google Home.
customer_reviews.text: Small unit, easy to install, works well so far. One note when pressing the Learn button on the drive unit, make sure to not press on it for too long, just click it, otherwise it would erase all of your existing programmed remote openers. One complain is integration with Nest / Google Home. No integration with Google Home yet and when you link MyQ and Nest, you would be adding the Nest devices to the MyQ app instead of the other way around.
customer_reviews.author: Hoei L

customer_reviews.title: You cannot rely on this product to work all the ...
customer_reviews.text: You cannot rely on this product to work all the time, loses connectivity to the the base, phone app cant find the device. And sometime when it does find the device, the doors dont open or close, even though the app shows doors closing/opening. Totally unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Devinder Singh

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm pretty satisfied, however, it would be nice if the unit could override the remote lockout feature the way our wireless wall keypad does. If we want to be able to remotely open or shut the door, we lose the ability to lock the door. Our keypad on the outside wall opens the door whether the lockout is engaged or not. The app that shows the open/closed status of the door is one of the best features. You'll always know if/when your door is opened/closed.
customer_reviews.author: Chinner08

customer_reviews.title: This product installed easily and links well
customer_reviews.text: This product installed easily and links well. Just make sure you have good WiFi where you want to mount the receiver and you should be good to go. I love that it has the option to send me push notifications and/or emails for all garage door activity. It even keeps a history. Very handy. I'd buy it again any day! Also, if you check the warehouse deals it can be found for about $77 but well worth the full price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: The actual installation of the units are easy and straightforward
customer_reviews.text: The actual installation of the units are easy and straightforward. It is the pairing that causes trouble. During the setup process, we always get the false open errors which prevent the item to work properly. It was very frustrating. My husband tried so many times and re-installed the apps and reset the product many times as well try to get it to work. After couple days, all of the sudden, it started to work fine. I have to say, if it's not the frustrating setup process that we had experienced, this product, when it's working without application errors, it's a very convenient product to have for one's garage. It allows us to open/close garage remotely.
customer_reviews.author: Yingying Huang

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and I was able to integrate with my Wink Hub. I have it set to send me an alert anytime the Garage is open for more than 15 minutes so that I can close it if nobody is actually in the garage. My only complaint is that I wish it had IFTTT compatability, or that IFTTT & Wink integration didn't block shortcuts involving garage doors or that I could have it work natively with my Amazon Echo. Unfortunately right now I can control the garage via voice command on my echo for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the expense!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. I have a 10+ year old opener I really have no idea how old it is, it came with our 40 yr old house. The sellers didn't give us an opener, and yeah I know a cheapo opener is $15-20, but then you need two... For me this was worth the price difference because I not only get an opener on my phone, I get notifications when the door is still open and can open it from anywhere, i.e. let the friends/family/service people in when I can't be there. It took less than 10 min to install with our old opener.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Item was defective
customer_reviews.text: This unit was defective and would not connect to the network. I called Chamberlin support and after their troubleshooting efforts the unit still could not be connected. After looking up the serial number they discovered that this unit had been registered by a previous customer in back in 2018. Their conclusion was I had been sent a used, defective unit. I would give this zero stars if that was an option.
customer_reviews.author: David Parker

customer_reviews.title: you may be happy. But if you are like me
customer_reviews.text: It got 1 star bc I could not rate it for less...if this is the ONLY means you want to open a garage door besides the button controller that your opener came with, you may be happy. But if you are like me, a mom to a family of 6, no, not going to work. Key pad won’t work, car access buttons won’t work, kids stuck outside while I am working. Their app won’t work and the key pad won’t work either. It is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I work in the IT field. Computers, routers, most electronics are second nature to me. This device was a complete disaster to configure and have my garage door find. Garage would open and close randomly as well. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: In spite of all the negative reviews on this product, I'm giving it 5 stars!...As another review states--take your time selecting your BRAND of garage door opener. Example: I have a Genie Powermax 1500...you select it as Powermax, NOT Genie so be careful with that. It appears many of the issues in the past with setup have been resolved. As a note, I have a Apple Time Capsule router and had no issues with connectivity. When it tells you to press the test button on the door sensor, you might have to hold it for a few seconds or press it again and the hub will beep. Just be patient when installing
customer_reviews.author: Charles G Crutcher

customer_reviews.title: Less than 20min box to finish!
customer_reviews.text: So very easy to install (about 4 or 5 min) 2 screws in the mount, slide on the unit and plug it in). And about 12-15 minutes later it was working over my mobile data connection (turned off wifi just to be sure). I registered on the website (Chamberlain) before it arrived but still had to register through the app (android). App walks you through setup so unless you forget your glasses and can't read the very large font of the app, you won't have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Justjager

customer_reviews.title: Works well and notices if door opens, and you can check to see if it is closed
customer_reviews.text: This works well. Follow instructions and put the hub at least 2 feet from the overhead door motor/controler. Programmed on my iPhone and set up rules. Notifies me in the notification center and via email. Now I know if door went jp or not. You can open or close door from your phone as well as your regular means of controlling the door. Either way you get notifications. You can set up rules on notifications, door opening, door closing , etc. Very happy with the installation and the way it functions. ​
customer_reviews.author: G. Speck

customer_reviews.title: Update after 1yr+, disappointed...good product, but didn't know it was an open incomplete box...
customer_reviews.text: Disabling the scheduling and adding it to the newer model makes it clear to me these guys will be out of business in the not too distant future. Google/Nest or Apple will come in and eat their lunch. Subscription for home automation integration and taking features away, not a winning brand loyalty recipe...I would suggest not doing business with them. Previously: works great, easy to install. Package was previously opened which I was not happy to see...I decided to fall on the sword and keep it, though it was missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Jacketfan14

customer_reviews.title: Take control of your garage door!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Use your phone to open the garage for someone, yes, use your phone to close the door when you forget, yes. Alerts? Absolutely always be alerted to comings and going to your garage. Seriously I can't talk this up enough. Pretty easy to install. Easy to get on your wifi network and the app is basic enough for your grandparents to use. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service: device no longer working
customer_reviews.text: This worked wonderfully for about two months and then stopped working. We tried multiple times to reset it, my husband called the company (which is only available during business hours) and tried to get tech support. Ultimately, they said they could not help or replace and blamed on our internet connection. Our internet works perfect with everything else. We would like help to repair, replacement, or money back.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Chilek

customer_reviews.title: Provides flexibility for control over your garage door
customer_reviews.text: Alerts for open and close garage door can be delayed at times. Not sure why. Nice to be able to open and close remotely. Was disappointed to find out that this version you can't schedule door to close if open. I returned this and ordered the newer version which works good.
customer_reviews.author: Larry F

customer_reviews.title: 2 Warranty Claims after 4 hours of troublshooting... this product is horrible
customer_reviews.text: This product has failed on me twice in the last six months. It loses connection to the internet and won't reconnect even after reset TWICE. You go through the reboot process and reconnection and it's the product that has failed. I sat with customer service.... waited an HOUR on the phone and went through troubleshooting for another HOUR... TWICE. They sent me replacement products that took TWO weeks to replace under warranty. This is unacceptable; it's your product that failed. Overnight me the product or at least two day delivery. If it works... it works great. But unfortunately it rarely does.
customer_reviews.author: Ecarp

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t stay connected to the WiFi. The router is less than 20 ft from the MyQ hub. It’s finicky and not compatible with my other smarthome devices.
customer_reviews.author: IBuyThings

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my garage.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Did buy again. This one was for a Christmas gift for my sister and her husband. I bought one for myself later. I love it and any future garages I may have will get one. I have a camera to monitor the garage upon notification that the door has opened. My favorite feature is being able to let people in through my garage remotely.
customer_reviews.author: RBosox

customer_reviews.title: The tech support is not good. When we finally messed with it on our ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is a nightmare. We have a compatible garage door opener, but this product will not work correctly. The tech support is not good. When we finally messed with it on our own and finally got it working it killed the openers built into our vehicles. When we fixed / relinked the car then the myQ stopped working. Product is expensive junk with poor tech support as far as I am concerned.
customer_reviews.author: RJD

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it works great, that's if it works..
customer_reviews.text: This thing is truly hit or miss. There's nothing worse than having my car outside the driveway, getting errors about the hub being offline. Or how you just sit there like an idiot waiting for the door to open and even though it doesn't. There's been a few incidents where I had to enter my home from the backyard since the garage door itself would not open. I'd say this works maybe 65 percent of the time.
customer_reviews.author: A. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This product works only about half the time and never when you actually need it. It can't seem to connect with the sensor when you need to get in after returning from vacation. What a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I have to park my car outside occasionally and don't like leaving the garage door opener in it
customer_reviews.text: The Chamberlain garage door opener works very well. I have it connected to Wink and use the app on my phone more than I thought I would. I have to park my car outside occasionally and don't like leaving the garage door opener in it. Now I don't have to. It's also nice being able to check the status of the door. I work midnight shift and I have already checked a couple of time where the door was left open, so I just use the app on my phone to close it.
customer_reviews.author: Postalcop

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - But Does Not Solve LED Light Interference RF Conflict
customer_reviews.text: If you are getting this because of interference caused by LED lights, look elsewhere. All this basically does is creates another wireless remote in the 315Mhz range. I was under the impression that this used bluetooth or non RF to talk to the unit, but was having the same issues. I will say, it was pretty cool once I did get it configured. Take your time with the install, it is not that straight forward. Going to have to return and look for another option that does not use RF. Too expensive to start replacing all the LED bulbs I have been installing.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. I purchased this because my teen son would also always forget his house key and get locked out of the house. It was ok but it frequently lost connection with wi-fi, therefore it wouldn’t work. We verified that our wireless is good and not the “problem”. We since installed the Schlage key pad for our front door and that works amazing. Too bad I missed my return opportunity. It’s been unserviceable for 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long, features disappeared, not worth $$
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t last long. Sensor broke after a year. Replacement is over $50. A few features disappeared from the software. Can’t automatically close after a time “disabled for your protection “.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Utter Trash. Highly disappointed. Wish the manufacturer would refund my money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product. I bought this late last year, followed the instructions to a tee during installation, have fantastic wifi that covers my entire garage and beyond, and my success rate with this piece of garbage is probably around 30% at best. Yes, 2 in every 3 times I use the app to try and open or close my garage door, it fails. The manufacturer should pull this product off the market and stop duping people into buying it until they enhance it, fully test it, and make sure that it bloody works. Amazon should provide an option for a negative star rating especially for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Madden

customer_reviews.title: Fanstatic device
customer_reviews.text: I love this device, it allows me to know when my garage open and closes. I think this is the best technology that someone came up with. I love this device. I can literally open and close my garage door from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Scott

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Now suddenly charging an additional subscription for features - like integrating with Google Home.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A.

customer_reviews.title: Open or close the garage from anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy setup for the most part, i got hung up on the door sensor part. I removed the battery for 30 seconds and reinstalled. After that the app finally discovered the door sensor and I was able to complete the setup. Really annoying beep starts when the door is told to close. It would be nice to be able to disable this in the app! The screws that come with the kit are really poor quality screws. I am still not quite sure how this thing got connected to my wi-fi.
customer_reviews.author: Rosco4.6

customer_reviews.title: only work 25% of the time.
customer_reviews.text: This product installed fairly easily, even though craftsman had the wrong color button on them. Tech support solved that quickly. But that's where it ends. The phone app only works maybe 25% of the time. And the worst part is after 2 failed attempts you have to goto the door and close it. I may call customer support again, I may just get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Dietsch

customer_reviews.title: Great for us "forgetfuls"
customer_reviews.text: So we've had this Chamberlin IQ garage opener for about 3 weeks. So far, it has worked very well. My only piece of advice is to make sure your electric eyes are clear. We tried to close the garage door from about 30 miles away and there was something blocking the electric eyes. Our fault, but bummer the garage door couldn't close. The smart phone door closed/open notification feature is pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: dwit10

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of these and one was easy to install and works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Update : after using it over a year amd two of them they randomly start sending garagedoor open close emails and notifications like 20. So still unreliable after years of years. I bought two of these and one was easy to install and works as advertised. Second never linked to gateway so gave chamberlain a call, spend 20 minutes on the phone and they decided the gateway had a problem or sensor so returned one to amazon for an exchange and second one worked out of the box. They both tried to update their firmware during installation and both timed out and failed to update the firmware... so far working as advertised but sometimes disconnecting from routers....
customer_reviews.author: REDFOXXX

product_meta.title: Chamberlain MYQ-G0201 MyQ-Garage Controls Your Garage Door Opener with Your Smartphone
product_meta.description:
Open and close your garage door from anywhere with your Smartphone. Receive alerts when the garage door opens and closes. With Chamberlain's MyQ Garage, your Smartphone, Wi Fi and any compatible garage door opener, you are connected and in control. The Chamberlain MyQ Smartphone app is free with no monthly fees.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Universal Smartphone Garage Door ControllerMyQ. Stay close. Stay Connected. Chamberlain products enabled with MyQ technology now allow you the ability to use your smartphone as a garage door opener as well as operate outdoor lights and house lamps. This innovative new feature awards you amazing convenience and incredible peace of mind as you can now monitor any MyQ enabled product from near or far with the MyQ Home Control app. From anywhere in the world, the MyQ Home Control App you're able to: Control outdoor lights and your garage door using a Smartphone Get notified if your garage door opens or if a light was left on Know if your garage door opened while you were away Stay close. Stay connected. Stay in control with MyQ technology.
feature_bullets: Monitor, open and close your garage door from anywhere with your smartphone
Choose to receive alerts/notifications on your smartphone when you garage door opens and closes

Works with most brands of garage door openers made after 1993 that have standard safety sensors. Compatibility: MyQ smartphone App is available for Apple and Android devices including iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch and Android smartphones and tablets
Installs in minutes and works with your home's Wi Fi, via the Chamberlain MyQ Garage App
Included: Wi Fi Hub, Power Cord, Mounting Bracket, Door Sensor, Instructions for MyQ App download

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars1,735 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
